sbpl package¶

Module contents¶

SBPL module for remote printing

This provides the function of remote printing directly to the printer existing on your LAN by using SBPL (SATO Barcode Printer Language) provided by SATO Corp.

This enables arbitrary label cutting which can not be controlled by a normal Windows printer.

This module is a prototype and may not satisfy your work, but since it is Pure Python, you can add and change features yourself.

class sbpl.JsonParser(generator)[source]¶

Bases: object

Provide functions that can specify printing by SBPL with JSON.

Even a simple example of SBPL printing requires the execution of many commands. It is difficult to specify printing contents over a plurality of pages by a program, and correction becomes difficult. So we made it possible to designate all at once by JSON.

  • The outside of JSON is always a list, and the inside is an object or list.
  • Object specifies the host name of the print server to be printed, it can be specified only once at the beginning.
  • The list includes a print instruction for one page in one list in the list of print commands.

for example:

[
    {"host":"192.168.0.251", "port": 1024, "communication": "SG412R_Status5"},
    [
        {"set_label_size": [1000, 3000]},
        {"shift_jis": 0},
        {"rotate_270": 0},
        {"comment":"==ticket main=="},
        {"pos": [710, 130], "expansion": [6000], "ttf_write": "TEST CONSERT", "font": "mplus-1p-medium.ttf"},
        {"pos": [530, 1040], "expansion": [2700], "ttf_write": "Organizer: Python High School", "font": "mplus-1p-medium.ttf"},
        {"pos": [370, 50], "expansion": [3700], "ttf_write": "Friday, February 14, 2014 14:00", "font": "mplus-1p-medium.ttf"},
        {"pos": [300, 80], "expansion": [2800], "ttf_write": "Indoor playground", "font": "mplus-1p-medium.ttf"},
        {"pos": [230, 30], "expansion": [3500], "ttf_write": "Free seat $5.00", "font": "mplus-1p-medium.ttf"},
        {"pos": [180, 50], "expansion": [1800], "ttf_write": "Drinks can be brought in but alcohol is prohibited.", "font": "mplus-1p-medium.ttf"},
        {"comment":"==barcode=="},
        {"pos": [260, 930], "codebar": ["0004693003005000", 3, 100]},
        {"pos": [160, 1000], "expansion": [1,1], "bold_text": "0004693003005000"},
        {"comment":"==ticket parted=="},
        {"pos": [780, 1610], "expansion": [2500], "ttf_write": "TEST", "font": "mplus-1p-medium.ttf"},
        {"pos": [670, 1610], "expansion": [2500], "ttf_write": "CONSERT", "font": "mplus-1p-medium.ttf"},
        {"pos": [620, 1630], "expansion": [2000], "ttf_write": "Friday, February 14, 2014 14:00", "font": "mplus-1p-medium.ttf"},
        {"pos": [580, 1630], "expansion": [2000], "ttf_write": "14:00", "font": "mplus-1p-medium.ttf"},
        {"pos": [420, 1610], "expansion": [2000], "ttf_write": "Free seat", "font": "mplus-1p-medium.ttf"},
        {"pos": [330, 1600], "expansion": [2000], "ttf_write": "$5.00", "font": "mplus-1p-medium.ttf"},
        {"print": 1}
    ]
]

usage:

json_str = "(defined adobe)"
comm = SG412R_Status5()
gen = LabelGenerator()
parser = JsonParser(gen)
parser.parse(json_str)
parser.post(comm)
Parameters:generator – Instances of LabelGenerator or its derived classes
parse(json_str)[source]¶

Issue the SBPL command while reading the contents of JSON.

Parameters:json (str, or return value of json.loads()) – JSON which describes contents to be printed. If a character string is given, it is passed to json.load()
parse_line(line)[source]¶

Convert the instruction described in JSON to SBPL command

Parameters:line – The dict expressing the instruction described in JSON
post(comm)[source]¶

Execute remote printing using communication settings described in JSON

When the print destination is fixed, it is not necessary to include it in JSON, but it is required to select _comm_setting manually or not to call this method.

Parameters:comm – Communication module for SATO printer. For example, an instance of SG412R_Status5
class sbpl.LabelGenerator(packets=bytearray(b''))[source]¶

Bases: object

Generate a byte stream to be printed by SBPL.

Various commands for printing are held as methods, and by executing them, a byte string of SBPL is generated and held.

Parameters:packets (bytearray) – (optional) Cached bytearray will be the printing packet
barcode_ratio(ratio='1:3')[source]¶

Change the size of the barcode by changing the space between the bars.

However, there is a barcode that can not be output if it is set to other than ‘1:3’.

begin_packet()[source]¶

A packet must first execute this method at the beginning.

You must execute end_packet() later. To print multiple pages, execute the necessary number of begin_packet()/end_packet()

begin_page()[source]¶

Each page must first execute this command at the beginning.

You must execute begin_packet() just before. You must execute end_page() later. To print multiple pages, execute the necessary number of begin_page()/end_page()

bold_text(text)[source]¶

Print specified character string with built-in bold font

Parameters:text – String to output. Only alphanumeric symbols are valid
codabar(text, pitch, height)[source]¶

Output barcode of NW-7(CODABAR) standard

Valid characters: numbers, A,B,C,D, symbols. (-,$,/, . ,+)

Parameters:
  • pitch – Barcode thickness. When the number is increased, the width suddenly increases
  • height – Bar length of the bars. Pixel unit(1-999)
  • text – String to print.
code_128(text, pitch, height, code='B')[source]¶

Output barcode of CODE 128 standard

Valid characters: numbers, alphabets, symbols.（-,.,(space),＊,$,／,+,%） Four types of shift characters

Parameters:
  • pitch – Barcode thickness. When the number is increased, the width suddenly increases
  • height – Bar length of the bars. Pixel unit(1-999)
  • text – String to print.
  • code – Specify code start allowed by Code 128. A, B, C are valid, default is B. See the standard for details.
code_39(text, pitch, height)[source]¶

Output barcode of CODE 39 standard

Valid characters: numbers, alphabets, symbols（-,.,(space),＊,$,／,+,%）の43 charactors

Parameters:
  • pitch – Barcode thickness. When the number is increased, the width suddenly increases
  • height – Bar length of the bars. Pixel unit(1-999)
  • text – String to print. Automatically enclosed in ‘*’
code_93(text, pitch, height)[source]¶

Output barcode of CODE 93 standard

Valid characters: numbers, alphabets, symbols.（-,.,(space),＊,$,／,+,%） Four types of shift characters

Parameters:
  • pitch – Barcode thickness. When the number is increased, the width suddenly increases
  • height – Bar length of the bars. Pixel unit(1-999)
  • text – String to print.
end_packet()[source]¶

A packet must last execute this method at the ending.

You must execute begin_packet() first. To print multiple pages, execute the necessary number of begin_packet()/end_packet()

end_page()[source]¶

Each page must last execute this command at the ending.

You must execute begin_page() first. You must execute end_packet() immediately after that. To print multiple pages, execute the necessary number of begin_page()/end_page()

expansion(exp=(1, 1), pitch=0)[source]¶

Specify magnification and pitch of character printing following this command

Parameters:
  • exp – Two-dimensional coordinates representing magnification (H_expansion,y_expansion) e.g. (1,2)
  • pitch – Specify the pitch between characters in pixels (0-99)
extend_str(tp)[source]¶

a list of arbitrary character strings into a string and then encode() and add into the bytearray

glyph_offset(pos, offset)[source]¶

Coordinate offset calculation corresponding to rotate

itf2of5(text, pitch, height)[source]¶

Output barcode of Interleaved 2 of 5 standard

Valid characters: numbers

Parameters:
  • pitch – Barcode thickness. When the number is increased, the width suddenly increases
  • height – Bar length of the bars. Pixel unit(1-999)
  • text – String to print.
jan_13(text, pitch, height)[source]¶

Output barcode of JAN 13 standard

Valid characters: numbers

Parameters:
  • pitch – Barcode thickness. When the number is increased, the width suddenly increases
  • height – Bar length of the bars. Pixel unit(1-999)
  • text – String to print. Must be 11 or 13 chars.
jan_8(text, pitch, height)[source]¶

Output barcode of JAN 8 standard

Valid characters: numbers

Parameters:
  • pitch – Barcode thickness. When the number is increased, the width suddenly increases
  • height – Bar length of the bars. Pixel unit(1-999)
  • text – String to print. Must be 6 or 8 chars.
line(length, thickness)[source]¶

Pull a vertical or horizontal lines (diagonal lines can not be pulled)

Parameters:
  • length – Specify only one of x or y in two-dimensional coordinates e.g. (123, 0) or (0, 456)
  • thickness – Line thickness (1-99)
packet_for_with()[source]¶
with gen.packet_for_with():
gen.somemethod() # generate inner packets
page_for_with()[source]¶
with gen.page_for_with():
gen.somemethod() # generate inner the page
pos(position)[source]¶

The start coordinates of the printing command to be continued are made.

Note that when you see a label standing behind the printer and its printed label, its upper left coordinate is (0, 0). x is rightward and y is downward. This instruction does not change with the rotate instruction.

Parameters:position – Two-dimensional coordinates representing the position(x,y) e.g. (100, 200)
print(num=1)[source]¶

How many copies of the current label should be printed.

If this command is not executed, labels are not printed.

rectangle(size, thickness)[source]¶

Draw a rectangle

Parameters:
  • size – (width,height) e.g. (123, 456)
  • thickness – Line thickness e.g.(2,2)
rotate_0()[source]¶

Set rotation of coordinate axis to 0 degree

This is the default orientation of SATO’s printer, and when you look at the label printed standing behind the printer, it is the direction in which the string is printed just as you have seen.

rotate_180()[source]¶

Set rotation of coordinate axis to 180 degree

rotate_270()[source]¶

Set rotation of coordinate axis to 0 degree

When you see the label printed on the right side of the printer, it is the orientation in which the string is printed exactly as you saw. You will execute this command if you want to use the paper sideways.

rotate_90()[source]¶

Set rotation of coordinate axis to 90 degree

set_font_path(getfontpath)[source]¶

Resolve the PATH of the font file.

If a font file exists other than the current directory, it is necessary to supplement this font path by calling this method beforehand. Give a function.

Parameters:getfontpath – Specify a function that takes str as an argument and returns str
set_label_size(size)[source]¶

Specify the size of the label to be printed.

Parameters:size – Specify the size of the label in two-dimensional(width,height) pixel coordinates. e.g. (100, 200)
shift_jis()[source]¶

Shift_JIS is specified as the character code to be sent to the printer.

It must be executed when printing multi-byte character strings. However, the string given to each method must be as str (automatically encode() is executed)

skip_cutting()[source]¶

Designate the printer not to cut the current label.

The behavior of this command varies depending on the settings of the printer itself. Use it with setting to cut every page. This command is valid only on the label that was executed, and it needs to be executed again on the next page.

to_bytes()[source]¶

bytearray to bytes

ttf_face(font, expansion, pitch)[source]¶

Freetype.Face is acquired using Freetype-py.

In the windows environment, dll is required under the name “freetype.dll” in the execution directory.

ttf_write(text, pos, maxwidth, align)[source]¶

Print with a GB instruction while rendering TrueType fonts

As GB instruction can usually print only one character, this class realizes processing for each character

Parameters:
  • text – The output character string. Line breaks are ignored. Halfwidth and double-byte spaces are treated as fixed width shifted respectively.
  • pos – Start coordinate to be printed. The positional relationship between pos and character string changes by rotate.
  • maxwidth – (optional)Specify the maximum width of the drawing area. The start position when center or right is specified with align is changed. Trimed when exceeding the maximum width.
  • align – (optional)Change the left and right position of the character string. center is the center of maxwidth, right is the right end.
write_text(text)[source]¶

Print specified character string with built-in font

Parameters:text (str) – String to output. For multibyte characters, it must be a character that exists in CP932
class sbpl.SG412R_Status5[source]¶

Bases: object

A communication class for printing when the printer of SATO is operating on STATUS 5

Since the communication specification when the printer is operating in STATUS 5 is not disclosed, this module was created by analyzing TCP / IP packet instead of manual.

Since the author confirmed the operation only with SG412R-ex, there is a possibility that it will not work on other models. In that case, please refer to this class and implement it yourself. Welcome your post.:

comm = SG412R_Status5()
with comm.open("192.168.0.251", 1024):
    comm.prepare()
    # generate label...
    gen = LabelGenerator()
    with self._gen.packet_for_with():
        with self._gen.page_for_with():
            gen.set_label_size((1000, 3000))
            gen.rotate_270()
            gen.pos((260, 930))
            gen.codebar(("0004693003005000", 3, 100))
            gen.pos((160, 1000))
            gen.expansion((1,1))
            gen.bold_text("0004693003005000")
            gen.print()
    comm.send(gen.to_bytes())
    comm.finish()
close()[source]¶
finish()[source]¶
open(host, port)[source]¶
prepare()[source]¶
send(packets)[source]¶
class sbpl.TtfGlyph(c, face, expansion)[source]¶

Bases: object

Handle glyph data for one character of TrueType font.

Fonts are rendered by FreeType-py and kept by instances of this class. Each glyph is rendered as a 1 bpp monochrome bitmap and issued as a GB command. It can be cached in units of character strings and SBPL can be actually generated after calculating the range of output character strings.

Parameters:
  • c (str) – The character to render. len(c)==1
  • face (freetype.face) – freetype.face
  • expansion (int) – Font expansion. maybe expansion = XXpt*72
generate(gen, position)[source]¶

Print the stored glyph data

Parameters:
  • gen (LabelGenerator) – Generator
  • position (tuple or list of 2-int) – Coordinates to be printed
offset()[source]¶

Return a tuple of the offset to the next character

offset_top()[source]¶

Vertical offset of character glyph

offset_x()[source]¶

Returns the offset to the next character

to_bytes()[source]¶

Returns a raw bitmap of 1bpp specified by (pwidth, pheight)

The bitmap requested by the ‘GB’ command is a monochrome 1bpp, it must be a unit of 8×8, and the number of pixels in the vertical and horizontal directions must be the same.

Return type:bytearray
